titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Francis William Crandall Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Carol King

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 10:59

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of typed letters written by Francis William Crandall to his parents while making the "grand tour" of Europe, Africa, and Asia. An edited version with notes and illustrations is also included. Highlights include a description of a safari in East Africa and attendance at a durbar in India.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Francis William Crandall Papers (MS 1772). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Francis William Crandall was born on Janurary 13, 1889, in Westfield, New York. He graduated from Yale University in 1911. After working in the lumber industry in the state of Washington, he relocated to Pittsburgh during the Depression. Crandall was a banker until his retirement in 1952. He died in 1959.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of typed letters written by Francis William Crandall to his parents while making the "grand tour" of Europe, Africa, and Asia. An edited version with notes and illustrations is also included. Highlights include a description of a safari in East Africa and attendance at a durbar in India.

did.unittitle: "Letters of Francis Crandall to His Parents Written from September 11, 1912 to May 10, 1912 During His Trip Around the World" [edited letters with explanatory notes and illustrations, compiled by F. William Crandall]
